alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 19 at 5:03PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Oahu in Honolulu County. * WHEN...Until 700 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 459 PM HST, radar indicated that heavy rain continued over northwest Oahu from Haleiwa to Mokuleia to Makua, but had diminished elsewhere. In the heaviest showers, rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Haleiwa, Waialua, Mokuleia, Dillingham Field, Kaena State Park and Makua. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 700 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action.
